newsitem.title: USA: High Plains Wheat - Basis continues to weaken.
newsitem.headline: High Plains Wheat - Basis continues to weaken.

text.p: Basis bids for hard red winter wheat continued to weaken Wednesday amid sluggish demand from both the domestic and export sectors.
"There aren't many people buying wheat right now. The mills here are bought up and even the mills in Mexico aren't buying as much as they were," a Kansas dealer said.

Merchandisers noted there had been patchy rain in Kansas overnight and some expressed disappointment that rainfall had not been more widespread. Further rains were forecast for Kansas and Oklahoma later this week, which should enhance already promising wheat crops, they said.
"It is beautiful wheat. Most of the co-ops round here could use the bushels," one Oklahoma dealer said, noting the state had poor crops both in 1995 and 1996.
Basis values in cents/bu against KCBT wheat, cash=dollars/bu.
(Note: K=KCBT May wheat futures. unq- unquoted, na - not applicable)
